Encourage use of millets in food and indigenous herbs and medicinal plants for nutrition and well being Awareness & Promotion of Mission LiFE and Encourage use of millets in food and indigenous herbsand medicinal plantsfor nutrition and well being.

Encourage use of millets in food and indigenous herbs and medicinal plants for nutrition and well being Head, Extension Division, RFRI delivered a presentation on 26-01-2023 on LiFE (Lifestyle for Environment) for sensitizing all the Scientists, Officers, Supporting & Ministerial Staff, Family Members and Children on various activities of LiFE Programme. He spoke about the aims and objectives, modus operandi and possible impact of LiFE Programme. He appealed to all for little change in our behavior and mindset to the environment friendly lifestyle. He elucidated seventy five actions to be followed by ourselves in our daily life for better world. He also mentioned about the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) and informed that Mission LiFE contributes directly and indirectly to almost all the SDGs.

Encourage use of millets in food and indigenous herbs and medicinal plants for nutrition and well being A lecture on â€œDiseases in daily life and their protectionsâ€ delivered by Chief Guest Dr. D.S. Mertiya of AFRI Dispensary. During this program he provided detailed information about communicable and non-communicable diseases in human caused by the current lifestyle. To get rid of these diseases, the Dr. Mertiya told Yoga, Pranayama to be useful. He also answered various queries of the audience. Sh. M.R. Baloch, Director AFRI also expressed his views on the subject. Dr. Tarun Kant, GCR, Smt. Bhawana Sharma, HoD, Extension Division, all Scientist/Officers/Staff are present in this program. The coordination of program was done Smt. Kusum Parihar.

Use LED bulbs/ tube-lights Effective measures were taken to implement the action points planned for promotion and observance of Mission LiFE one-week focused campaign from 10-14 July in Embassy of India, Moscow. Posters (standies) were installed in all the 3 Embassy buildings and digital publicity was done by sharing Mission LiFE content on Mission website and social media handles to encourage adoption of healthy lifestyle, energy saving, water saving and waste reduction practices, and reduce use of single-use plastic. Mission LiFE videos were played on loop in visitor hall of the Consular Wing. Embassy was declared a plastic free zone. Flushes, taps and water pipes of the Embassy were checked for any leakage. Bins were installed at various locations in the Embassy. Trees were planted by the Ambassador in JNCC premises on 14 July 2023.
